name: Green Canopy NODE
headline: Green Canopy NODE builds sustainable homes fast.
description:
Construction costs are climbing out of control, there is a declining construction workforce that gets smaller with every recession. Meanwhile, we’ve got a housing crisis in our major cities. 

Green Canopy NODE is the combination of NODE - construction technology start up that develops a house assembly kits that we manufacture in our factory in Seattle, and then ship flat-pack - like Ikea, and Green Canopy a vertically integrated developer, general contractor and real estate fund manager already operating in Seattle and Portland. 

We are continuing to develop and launch construction technology solutions including prefab components and software into our pipeline of residential projects ranging from small apartments, town houses, single family homes and small dwellings. Our mission is to build homes, relationships, and businesses that help regenerate communities and environments.

##### Green Canopy NODE
######  Together, we are building the future of housing. 
[ Learn More! ](http://greencanopynode.com/</construction-technologies>)
# Building Simplified.
We’re on a path to revolutionizing construction. It's time to simplify building and meet the growing demands for housing. Whether you need an [**integrated development** **partner**](http://greencanopynode.com/</development-services>) on your stick-framed multi-unit project or you'd like to take advantage of our prefabricated [**Building Kits**](http://greencanopynode.com/</construction-technologies>), we're dedicated to partnering with you to build faster and smarter.
[ Work With Us ](http://greencanopynode.com/</construction-technologies>)

Mass Timber Building Kits
Green Canopy NODE’s Buildings Kits for multi-unit homes and apartments provide greater cost control, quality, and speed.
The Mass Timber Model Home is a complete test of our **Integrated Kit** including prefabrication, installation, and logistics. Components were manufactured off-site and the two-story + rooftop deck homewas assembled in Spokane, WA.

generated_description:
**Green Canopy NODE: Building the Future of Housing**

Established in 2017 and hailing from Seattle, WA, Green Canopy NODE is tackling pressing issues in the housing industry with a straightforward mission: to construct sustainable homes quickly. The company emerged from a context of soaring construction costs, a shrinking workforce, and a housing crisis in urban regions—issues that have become more urgent during economic downturns.

At the heart of Green Canopy NODE lies an innovative collaboration between NODE—a construction technology startup creating flat-pack house assembly kits akin to Ikea—and Green Canopy, a seasoned player in the development, general contracting, and real estate investment space operating primarily in Seattle and Portland. This unique intersection of construction tech and real estate development allows Green Canopy NODE to streamline the home-building process by offering prefab components and software solutions across a diverse array of residential projects—from small apartments to single-family homes.

Green Canopy NODE is not just about constructing buildings; it's committed to regenerating communities. It aims to forge strong relationships and build sustainable businesses that have a positive environmental impact. Their portfolio includes over 300 homes built to all-electric, environmentally-friendly standards, certified by reputable organizations like Built Green and Earth Advantage. They’ve successfully mitigated approximately 35,000 metric tons of greenhouse gas emissions since their inception.

What’s truly engaging about Green Canopy NODE is their integrated approach. They not only offer prefabrication building kits but also a suite of development services that include consulting, construction management, and innovative architecture. Their focus on sustainable practices isn't just a checkbox; it’s embedded in their products—think all-electric, healthy homes designed to minimize their carbon footprint.

With a team of 31 employees, led by knowledgeable individuals in construction and property tech, they’re well-positioned to tackle the complexities of today's housing demands. As part of Y Combinator Batch S19, they've harnessed startup agility to deliver impactful solutions in the housing market.

If you're looking to learn more, you can explore their offerings or even join their mission through their website at [Green Canopy NODE](http://greencanopynode.com).
